author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Consulate-General of Japan in Chennai in association with ABK-AOTS Dosokai Tamil Nadu Centre and several other institutions is organising a Japanese speech contestto encourage students to express their thoughts in Japanese and to give them an opportunity to show their skills in the language.

According to a press release, the contest will be held on March 26 from 4 p.m. at the residence of the Consul-General of Japan in Chennai: 5-B, Chittaranjan Road, Teynampet.

The prize distribution will be held at 6.30 p.m. and the certificates will be presented by Seiji Baba, Consul-General of Japan in Chennai, the press release said.
title: Japanese speech contest
